page.title: 06Bishop of Llandaff school.
page.content: We go to a Church in Wales High School. There are about 1082 pupils from parishes all over S. Glam. In 1984-5 the biggest group came from Llandaff Cathedral parish (182) and from Whitchurch and Rhiwbina parish (190). We also have some Methodists and Roman Catholics. Every morning we have an assembly lasting about 25 minutes. On Tuesday the vicars from most parishes come to conduct a service for the pupils from their parish. Once every half term we go to the Cathedral, which is not far away from us, for a Eucharist service. Religious education lessons are compulsory. We take many other different subjects. Most of the pupils travel to school by bus or car. Those who live in Llandaff walk or ride bikes to school.
